alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 5:13PM MDT until June 06 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 600 PM MDT. * At 511 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Sapello, or 8 miles north of Las Vegas, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Romeroville, Montezuma, El Porvenir, Storrie Lake State Park, Sapello, Manuelitas and Gallinas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 340 and 356. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 11. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 4. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 7. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulations of hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.
